intro: Heterocentron hondurense, commonly known as the Honduran heterocentron, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, humid forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
